alert.note: Alert for Kimball (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 17 at 3:22AM CDT until June 17 at 3:45AM CDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 AM MDT FOR KIMBALL AND EAST CENTRAL LARAMIE COUNTIES... At 221 AM MDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 6 miles south of Albin to near Oliver Campground to 6 miles northwest of Westplains, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Kimball, Pine Bluffs, Oliver Campground, Oliver Reservoir, Kimball Airport and Bushnell. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 389 and 402. Interstate 80 in Nebraska between mile markers 1 and 29. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Wind damage with these storms will occur before any rain or lightning. Do not wait for the sound of thunder before taking cover. SEEK SHELTER IMMEDIATELY inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows.
